impl
Class ContactManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
  impl.ContactManagerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContactManager, java.io.Serializable
public class ContactManagerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContactManager, java.io.Serializable

Loads from file on construction, the default file is contacts.txt, but an alternate filename can be passed as a parameter into the constructor. Encodes to same file when flush() is called. Past meetings and Future meeting are separated in to two lists, however due to the passing of time meetings held in the future meeting list may have a date in the past, to convert you must call addMeetingNotes().

Author:
montywest
See Also:

getFutureMeetingList

public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
Description copied from interface: ContactManager
Returns the list of future meetings scheduled with this contact. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Specified by:
getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
contact - one of the user’s contacts
Returns:
the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
See Also:
"Creates a new list and adds to it if a contact is found in a meetings contact set when iterating through the future meeting list. Meetings are then sorted by date, furthest in the past to furthest in the future."

getFutureMeetingList

public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(java.util.Calendar date)
Description copied from interface: ContactManager
Returns the list of meetings that are scheduled for, or that took place on, the specified date If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Specified by:
getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
date - the date
Returns:
the list of meetings
See Also:
"Meetings are added to a new list if their date is on the same day as the param. Iterates through both meeting lists as PastMeetings with future dates may be in the past meetings list (due to the specification of addNewPastMeeting) and future meetings with past dates may be in the future meeting list (due to the passing of time). Meetings are then sorted by time, earliest to latest."

public void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                              java.util.Calendar date,
                              java.lang.String text)

Create a new record for a meeting that took place in the past.

text - messages to be added about the meeting.
See Also:
"Adds new PastMeeting to the past meeting list. A past meeting can be added with a future date, as per the interfaces specification (which is different from addFutureMeeting())."

addMeetingNotes

public void addMeetingNotes(int id,
                            java.lang.String text)
Description copied from interface: ContactManager
Add notes to a meeting. This method is used when a future meeting takes place, and is then converted to a past meeting (with notes). It can be also used to add notes to a past meeting at a later date.

Specified by:
addMeetingNotes in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
id - the ID of the meeting
text - messages to be added about the meeting.
See Also:
"First gets meeting by id and then checks whether is a FutureMeeting or PastMeeting. If it is a FutureMeeting it checks if the date is now in the past, if not it throws an IllegalArgumentException. If it is it removes if from the future meeting list, casts it to a PastMeeting and adds it to the past meeting list. Lastly, it add notes to the newly cast meeting, or one found in the past meeting list."

getContacts

public java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(int... ids)
Description copied from interface: ContactManager
Returns a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.

Specified by:
getContacts in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
ids - an arbitrary number of contact IDs
Returns:
a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.
See Also:
"Iterates through the array of ids, on each iteration it iterates through the set of contacts, and stops looping if there is an id match, if the iterator gets to the end of the set then the id is invalid and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. Any matches are added to a new set and then returned."

flush

public void flush()
Description copied from interface: ContactManager
Save all data to disk. This method must be executed when the program is closed and when/if the user requests it.

Specified by:
flush in interface ContactManager
See Also:
"Encodes the object to filename field using Java's serialization: ObjectOutputStream. It will not make a new file if file is not found, as the constructor does this."
